page.title: 16The 80th Birthday
page.content: Councillor Selwyn Davies joined the Old Borough Council in 1969 and was the last mayor of the Borough before its organization in 1973. Concillor Selwyn has no plans of retirement because he says, "They won't let me out at the moment!" His popularity at Cowbridge Town Hall certainly showed when they threw a surprise party in his honour on Friday 10th May.From 1941 to 1945 he served in the R.A.F. and he says one of his proudest moments was when he presented the seal of the Borough to R.A.F. St.Athan. The Councillors present were: D.A. Thomas, J. Jones, A. Rees(present Mayor), K. Gates, J. Hydon, H.Jenkins, J. Roberts, Mayoress P. Roberts, Town Clerk M. Frost, S. Golden, Mrs.A. Maitland, Mrs.A. Stone.
